title: 111_hr3623
content: No information provided. Congress acknowledges that a significant number of African-American farmers had their discrimination claims denied without a hearing on the merits in the Pigford v. Glickman case. Section 14012 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 aims to provide a full determination on the merits for these denied claims and authorizes expedited resolutions, with $100,000,000 allocated for this purpose from the Commodity Credit Corporation. The $100,000,000 allocated from the Commodity Credit Corporation is not a cap but a placeholder for Congress to increase funding as needed to address discrimination claims by over 77,000 African-American farmers. Additional funding will be necessary to ensure each Pigford claim is determined on its merits. SEC. 2. FUNDING FOR PIGFORD CLAIMS. Section 14012 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 (122 Stat. 2209; Public Law 110-246) is amended to include criminal penalties for executing a scheme to defraud or obtain money through false pretenses related to Pigford claim eligibility. The amended Section 14012 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 includes criminal penalties for executing a scheme to defraud or obtain money through false pretenses related to Pigford claim eligibility, such as placing or receiving items through postal or interstate carriers. The amended Section 14012 of the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 includes criminal penalties for violating postal or interstate carrier regulations, with fines or imprisonment up to 5 years. After the expenditure of all funds under paragraph (1), additional payments for claims against the United States will be paid from appropriated funds. Attorney's fees and expenses related to adjudicating claims under subsections (b), (f), or (g) will also be covered. Payments for claims against the United States under subsections (b), (f), or (g) will be covered from appropriated funds under section 1304 of title 31, United States Code. Authorization of additional appropriations is also provided to carry out this section.
